title: Live Scrubber
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a live event
custom_steps: WHEN the user is viewing the video player scrubber and utilizing its features
custom_expected:
THEN at the live point the scrubber bar is completely blue to show a user is at the live point

AND the end of the scrubber shows “Live” text with red indicator.

title: Live Scrubber - Pause/Rewind
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a live event
custom_steps:
WHEN the user rewinds or pauses the scrubber 
AND the user is no longer at the live point
custom_expected:
THEN the user can visibly see they are not currently at the live point. 
AND the live indicator will turn gray to show the user isn’t at live point.
AND the remaining text on the right shows time until live or is empty if live

title: Game Info when scrubbing and FF/RW
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user pauses a game, certain UI elements should be displayed while the video is paused and should stay displayed as long as the controls are visible until normal playback speed resumes again.
custom_steps: WHEN the user pauses a game
custom_expected:
THEN a pill above the scrubber appears with the team match up and scores

AND the inning and outs show below the scrubber.

AND the elapsed time will show above the Pill

AND the position of UI elements should track the playhead during FF/RW operations

AND the data on the UI elements should update to reflect the game state at the playhead as the user scrubs backwards and forwards.

title: Live Game Innings Marker
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a live game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user utilizes the scrubber
AND the user is viewing the innings markers
custom_expected:
THEN the scrubber should render and display inning markers based on time position.

AND the inning markers should dynamically redraw to the correct position given that time is always changing.

AND after starting to watch a live game, innings markers should appear on scrubber bar as the game progresses and each half-inning is started.

title: Archived Game Innings Marker
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing an archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user utilizes the scrubber bar
AND the user views the innings markers
custom_expected:
THEN scrubber should render and display inning markers based on time position.

AND if the game does not have inning markers (spring training) do not show inning markers on scrubber.

title: CC
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is utilizing the video player on their tvOS app
AND the user wishes to turn ON/OFF closed captioning
custom_steps:
WHEN the user focuses on the CC button
AND the user selects CC button
custom_expected:
THEN the user can toggle the CC on/off
AND the button will display “Turn CC On” or “Turn CC Off” when the button is in focus

title: CC - Global Settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is utilizing the video player on their tvOS app
AND the user selected CC ON in the global settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user views content on the video player
custom_expected: THEN CC will be turned on

title: CC - Other Videos
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is utilizing the video player on their tvOS app
AND the user enabled CC on another video
custom_steps: WHEN the user exits and enters a new video player
custom_expected: THEN the CC will still remain enabled

title: Single Press Sensitivity
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

1. The user is viewing a game on their tvOS device

AND

1. The user performs a single press on the remote touch pad
custom_steps:
WHEN 

1. The user performs a single press on the remote touch pad
custom_expected:
THEN 

1. The scrubber is focused

NOTE: Sensitivity of the single press action is reduced.

title: Jump to Live
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is viewing a game on the tvOS Video Player
AND the user is behind the live point
custom_steps: WHEN the user actions the Jump to Live button
custom_expected:
THEN the feed should advance to the live point
AND the Jump to live icon is no longer visible
AND the live indicator is red

title: Visibility Gestures
custom_preconds:
GIVEN 

+ The user enters a video 

AND

+ Video controls are visible
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user does not interact with the remote approx. 5-10 seconds
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The controls will dismiss

AND

+ When the user presses back/menu will exit the video and return the user to the previous screen they were on.

AND

+ If the are not displayed, the user can tap the trackpad to display the controls.

title: FF/RW
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a VOD or LIVE content
custom_steps: WHEN a user presses and holds left/right
custom_expected:
THEN the video will FF/RW

AND releasing and pressing left/right again will increase the speed.

AND the FF/RW speed will appear below the scrubber and should update as the user increases or decreases the speed.

AND RW will stop once it reaches the beginning.

AND if the video is currently in FF and then the user presses left to RW, the FF will slow down by one step and vice versa.

title: Jump Forward/Backward
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a vod or live content
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on left/right with a single press
custom_expected:
THEN a jump 15 seconds UI element will show below the scrubber
AND the flash icon should appear for 1 second.

title: Play/Pause
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a VOD or live content
custom_steps: WHEN the user wishes to play/pause the content by tapping on the remote
custom_expected:
THEN on pausing, a pause icon will show in the middle of the screen and disappear after a second with the video still paused

AND on resuming playback, a play button will appear in the middle of the screen then disappear after a second

title: Resume Feature
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user returns to a game in which they previously watched
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the game again
custom_expected: THEN the user will be at the same spot where they left off

title: Resume Feature LIVE
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user wants to watch a live game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects a video feed from the feed picker
AND the user has previously watched this feed
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see a "Resume" option in the next modal
AND the game feed will resume from the point where that user previously left off

title: Resume Feature ARCHIVE
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user wants to watch an archive game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user selects a video feed from the feed picker
AND the user previously watched the feed
custom_expected:
THEN the user should see options for Resume and Start from the Beginning
AND "Start from the beginning" starts the feed from the beginning of the broadcast

title: Start from the beginning - NOT WATCHED
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user wants to watch an archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches an archived feed
AND the user has never watched the broadcast
custom_expected: THEN the user will always start the broadcast from the beginning.

title: Resume Point - 90 Days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user stopped watching a broadcast feed
AND the watch point has been bookmarked
custom_steps: WHEN the user does not resume the broadcast for 90 Days
custom_expected:
THEN the resume point will expire
AND the game will no longer hold bookmarks.

title: Resume Point - End of Game/Slate
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has watched the end of the broadcast to it's fullest
custom_steps: WHEN the user navigates back to the previous page and tries to launch playback again
custom_expected: THEN the "Resume" point and feature are no longer available

title: Hero Requirements - Hide Spoilers ON
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is viewing the HERO (Live Game)
AND the user has watched the game previously
AND Hide Scores feature is enabled
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the game
custom_expected: THEN the feed will start from the Resume point

title: Hero Requirements - Hide Spoilers OFF
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is viewing the HERO (Live Game)
AND the user has watched the game previously
AND Hide Scores feature is disabled
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the broadcast
custom_expected: THEN the feed will resume at the live point

title: Suspended Player
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing a game on the ATV MLB app
custom_steps:
WHEN the user holds down the menu button on the ATV remote
AND the user selects the AppleTV app
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to launch the same game from the AppleTV app

title: Launching from AppleTV app
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the AppleTV app after suspending the video player from the MLB app
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the same feed (watch live, resume, or beginning) OR a different game
custom_expected: THEN the user will be able to confirm playback in the MLB app at the given point selected

title: Hero
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

* The user has navigated to the Watch Now segment in the Watch section
custom_steps:
WHEN

* The user launches a live or archived game, SVOD, SLive, VOD, or FLive event from the hero tile
custom_expected:
THEN

* The video player will auto-launch the home or favorited team's broadcast without a feed picker, and all other mixed content successfully

title: Validate playback 90 minutes after game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN 

+ The user is blacked out from viewing a live game (Local or national blackout)
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The game has switched from Live to archive

AND

+ 90 minutes has passed 

AND

+ The user attempts to launch the game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The game will successfully launch without a blackout message

title: Launch second media content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has selected the PiP quick action button on the video player

AND

+ Navigates to the Home page with the mini-player functioning as expected
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Launching another video tile on the page (Ensure user is entitled to games, slive, or svod)
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The second video will play in full-screen with volume enabled

AND

+ The initial video in PiP continues to play on mute

title: Return to Full-Screen (With 2nd Content Playing)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the PiP feature with playback

AND

+ Launches another content in full-screen view
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user presses the Menu button on their Apple TV remote

AND

+ Selects the "Full-screen" quick-action option
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The content playing in PiP mode will return to full-screen

AND

+ The secondary video will dismiss

title: Return to Full-Screen (With 2nd Content Dismissed)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the PiP feature with playback

AND

+ Launches a second content in full-screen view from the Home page
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user presses the back button on their remote to navigate back to the Home page 

AND 

+ Presses the Menu button on their Apple TV remote

AND

+ Selects the "Full-screen" quick-action option
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The content playing in PiP mode will return to full-screen

title: Pressing Home button on remote to utilize options
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has content in PiP view
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user presses the Home button on their Apple TV remote (Monitor icon on 4K remote)
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The PiP Options quick-action buttons will be displayed

AND

+ The user can either Exit, Move the player, or Maximize the mini-player

title: Move Mini-player location
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the PiP feature
custom_steps:
WHEN 

+ Tapping on the Apple TV home button to display the mini-player options

AND

+ The user selects the Move quick-action button on the PiP options
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user can move the mini-player to the top-right, top-left, bottom-left, or bottom-right of the MLB app

AND

+ Pressing back on the remote will snap the mini-player to that desired location on the screen

title: Exit Button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is utilizing the PiP feature
custom_steps:
AND

+ The user presses the home button on the remote to display the quick action buttons on the PiP mini-player

AND

+ The user presses the close option or "X"
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The mini-player will dismiss

AND

+ Audio from the content will not be heard

title: Audio & Playback
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ A user playing audio from an outside app (eg Spotify)
custom_steps:
WHEN 

+ The user plays a video from the MLB app
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The outside audio should stop playback

AND

+ The only audio that should be heard is from the video launched from the MLB app

title: Logos
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user navigates to the "Details" overlay on the video player by swiping down from the scrubber
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The away team logo will be displayed above the Home team logo

AND

+ The correct branding will be displayed

AND

+ The logos cannot be focused on

title: Innings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game 

AND

+ Has navigated to the "Details" overlay on the video player by swiping down from the scrubber
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Observing the innings markers for a live or archived game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Innings 1-9 should be displayed over the top-half and bottom-half run totals for both teams

AND

+ If a run is scored in an inning, the total updates as expected in the correct row for the home or away team

title: Extra Innings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game 

AND

+ Has navigated to the "Details" overlay on the video player by swiping down from the scrubber
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Observing the innings markers for a live or archived game

AND

+ The game has gone into extra innings
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Innings 1-9 should be displayed over the top-half and bottom-half run totals for both teams

AND

+ After the 9th inning, a ">" marker is displayed to inform the user that more innings are available to view and jump to

AND

+ If the user has navigated to the 9th inning or later, a "<" marker will be displayed at the beginning of the linescore to inform the user that the earlier inning markers are hidden

title: Less Than 9 Innings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has launched a live or archived game 

AND

+ Has navigated to the "Details" overlay on the video player by swiping down from the scrubber
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Observing the innings markers for a live or archived game

AND

+ The game completes before 9 innings (Example: NEU vs BOS 7-Inning game on 2/23/24)
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Innings 1-9 should be displayed over the top-half and bottom-half run totals for both teams

AND

+ The inning columns after the final out (EX: 8 and 9 in a 7-Inning game) will not display a "0" and will remain blank

title: Jump to Innings Functionality
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is focused on a top-half or bottom-half of an inning on the linescore
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Selecting (or pressing down on the remote) a half-inning from earlier in the game

OR

+ Selecting a half-inning later in the game if streaming at an earlier playback point
custom_expected:
THEN

+ Video playback will resume at the desired point of the game

title: Runs, Hits, Errors
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has navigated to the linescore overlay on the video player when swiping down from the scrubber and focusing on "Details"
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Observing the linescore stat columns for both home and away teams
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will see R, H, and E for Runs, Hits, and Errors (Team totals)

AND

+ Each stat category will update as expected

title: Now Batting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is viewing the linescore section available in the "Details" segment of the video player overlay
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Viewing the "Now Batting" section to the right of the linescore section
custom_expected:
THEN

Displayed will be:

+ Batter's name (first above last)
+ Batter's headshot
+ Batter's At Bats (EX: 2-4 above "Today")
+ Batter's Average (EX: .300 above "AVG")
+ Batter's On-Base + Slugging (.800 above "OPS")

title: Pitching
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is viewing the linescore section available in the "Details" segment of the video player overlay
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ Viewing the "Pitching" section to the right of the linescore section
custom_expected:
THEN

Displayed will be:

+ Pitcher's name (first above last)
+ Pitchers's headshot
+ Pitcher's Pitch Count (EX: 100 over "PITCHES")
+ Pitcher's Inning's Pitched (EX: 6.2 over "IP")
+ Pitcher's Earned Run Avg. (EX: 2.65 over "ERA")

title: Hide Scores Enabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has Hide Scores enabled in their app settings

AND

+ The user launches a live or archived game
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user views the linescore under "Details" in the video player overlay below the scrubber
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The inning markers will only display scores that match the user's progression 

AND

+ The user cannot utilize the linescore if launching from beginning

OR

+ The user can utilize the jump to inning feature or scrubbing back if at the live point

title: No Additional Games
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user launches a game from a date that does not have any other games played on it 

Example: World Series Game
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user navigates below the video scrubber to display the "Games" segment on the player overlay

AND

+ "Games" is focused on
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will observe the copy "No Additional Games Today, Swing Back Later" displayed.

title: Games Carousel
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user launches a game from a date with multiple games available
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user navigates below the video scrubber to display the "Games" segment on the player overlay

AND

+ "Games" is focused on
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The user will observe all game tiles from that date

AND

+ On the game tile will display the away team logo, city tri-code, and run total on the left

AND

+ The home team logo, city tri-code, and run total on the right

title: Launching Another Game
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user launches a game from a date with multiple games available
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user navigates below the video scrubber to display the "Games" segment on the player overlay

AND

+ The user focuses on and launches a game tile in the games carousel available
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The expected game will launch without any issues

AND

+ An archived game in FINAL will launch from the beginning

OR

+ A live game in progress  will launch from the live point (Unless hide scores is available)

title: Hide Scores On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user has Hide Scores enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user launches a game on a date with more than one matchup available

AND

+ The user navigates below the scrubber to display the "Games" segment on the video player overlay
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The game tiles within the carousel will not display any scores for other games

title: Game Labels
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is observing the game tiles within the carousel on the "Games" segment of the video player overlay
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ A free game of the day is available on that date
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The "[MLB Logo] Free" tag or badge will be displayed above the game tile

title: Broadcast Options General
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is viewing the broadcast options menu for Video/Audio
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user focuses on the broadcast options in the nav bar
custom_expected:
THEN

+ The broadcast panel opens

AND

+ The user can see all available audio/video feeds

AND

+ The current feed playing will have a blue select state
 
AND

+ The audio options are only for the current selected video feed

AND

+ Selecting a new Audio or Video option will reload the video in the same place and the menu will remain open until the user manually dismisses or auto dismisses after 10 seconds.

title: Broadcast Options General More
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing the broadcast options menu for Video/Audio
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects a new broadcast to view
custom_expected:
THEN selecting a video or audio feed will immediately switch the playback to that feed and close the Broadcast options panel

AND selecting a different video feed will also update the available audio options. The first audio option listed (TV feed) is automatically selected.

AND pressing Menu/Back will return the user to full video screen and closes the menu

AND

title: Broadcast Options General (Non Entitled)
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing the broadcast options menu for Video/Audio
custom_steps: WHEN the user is not entitled to a feed
custom_expected: THEN the button should show as locked/disabled

title: Broadcast Video Options
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing broadcast options for video feeds
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the video options list
custom_expected:
THEN the video feed will be formatted as Team logo - Team short name - broadcast name (eg. Logo PHI - NBCSP)

AND the home feed will be listed first

AND for national feeds display the broadcaster logo 

AND feeds will be disabled if user is non entitled

title: Broadcast Audio Options
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is viewing broadcast options for audio feeds
custom_steps: WHEN the user views the list for audio feeds
custom_expected:
THEN the audio feeds will be formatted as “TV/Radio” - Broadcast name - Language (Eg. Logo TV - NBCSP - Spanish”)

AND if there are more than 2 Audio options available, show them in a grid with 2 per column

title: Switching feeds
custom_preconds: GIVEN an entitled user watching an MLBtv feed on tvOS

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects an alternate video broadcast
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the alternate video will play from the same point in the game with the associated audio

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user has changed to the alternate video feed
AND the user selects BROADCAST OPTIONS
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the audio feed options associated with the new video that is playing will be displayed to the right of the video options

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user selects an alternate audio feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the alternate audio will play without affecting video playback

title: Game Tile & Hero
custom_preconds:
GIVEN

+ The user is not logged into an account with MLB.tv entitlements
custom_steps:
WHEN

+ The user observes the tile or hero image for an mlb.tv game
custom_expected:
THEN

+ A lock icon will display

AND

+ The user is unable to launch the game
